title: Forum earns top honors in North Dakota newspaper contest
body_text:
FARGO — The Forum of Fargo-Moorhead and its staff took home 75 awards among daily newspapers in the North Dakota Newspaper Association's 2024 Better Newspaper Contest.
The Forum won the Sweepstakes award for overall cumulative wins.
ADVERTISEMENT
First place winners
Anna Paige, ag reporting, for a story on the annual Western Minnesota Steam Threshers’ Reunion in Rollag, Minn.
April Baumgarten, government reporting series, for her ongoing coverage of former Attorney General Wayne Stenehjem's deleted emails.
Ashelin Rose, front page design excellence.
Danielle Teigen, feature series, for her stories in honor of Women's History Month.
David Jones, outdoors/sports ad.
David Samson, ag photo, news photo and pictorial photo.
Helmut Schmidt, headline, " Has the craft beer market hit the pint of no return, or is it time to toast new opportunities?"
ADVERTISEMENT
Jamie Dettling, ag ad, health care ad, promo of community ad, small space ad and use of color.
Jeff Kolpack, sports column, " Fellow Fargoans, when did we get so stagnant and old?"
Jess Hastings, promo of newspaper ad.
Keith Harriger, home/gardening ad and single ad.
Kris Adams, signature ad page.
Mark Merck, section/feature front.
Matthew Von Pinnon, reporting, " Mother of man killed outside West Fargo church says he slept there, called it home."
ADVERTISEMENT
Melisssa Van Der Stad, reporting series, for her ongoing stories about efforts to address homelessness.
Ryan Spitza, sports reporting, " At long last, Fargo North hosts 1st-ever track and field meet."
Tammy Swift, personal column - humorous, " What to do when your inner Karen comes out of nowhere."
Tracy Briggs and Kate Almquist, best use of social media, for a callout asking North Dakota readers to help an East Coast student learn about North Dakota.
Wendy Reuer, feature reporting, " People can change."
Forum staff, best special section and standing news front.
ADVERTISEMENT
Second place winners
Alyssa Goelzer, spot news photo and news photo.
April Baumgarten, government reporting series, for her stories about a 2023 Fargo police shooting.
David Olson, government reporting series, for his stories about a whistleblower complaint filed by the director of the Rural Export Center in Fargo.
David Samson, feature photo, outdoor recreation photo, picture story and portrait photo.
Eric Peterson, sports reporting, " Minot coach calls Gus Engelhard's 80-foot buzzer-beater 'one in a million'".
Jamie Dettling, entertainment/liquor ad.
Jessie Andren, food ad.
ADVERTISEMENT
Kaity Young, headline, " Fargo reaches TIF-ing point in demolition of blighted buildings."
Keith Harriger, best digital ad.
Melissa Van Der Stad and Matt Henson, online coverage of breaking news, " Central Fargo shooting victim dies; 1 person 'detained .'"
Mike McFeely, sports feature, " New Alabama football coach Kalen DeBoer hasn't forgotten his hometown of Milbank, S.D. "
Ryan Spitza, sports column, "That was a rough one."
Tammy Swift, ag coverage, " Halstad businessman is no small fry when it comes to bringing potatoes to market ," and business reporting, " Vanna Vans zooms into 2024 faster, leaner and more driven than ever ."
Tammy Swift and Tasha Carvell, feature series, for their stories on Velva, North Dakota, and it's future following the closure of the Dot's Pretzels factory.
ADVERTISEMENT
Tasha Carvell and Chris Flynn, spot news, " Fargo crews use bulldozers, dump trucks to clear homeless encampment ."
Tracy Briggs, feature reporting, " The Gray Lady of Sims ."
Troy Becker, informational graphics, "Former ND Sen. Ray Holmberg appears Aug. 8 in U.S. District Court in Fargo."
Forum staff, editorial, editorial page, sports page/section, website and overall design excellence.
Third place winners
Amy Fredrickson, promo of newspaper readership ad.
Andrew Haugland, sports feature, "Long road leads Davies thrower Lily to NDSU."
Anna Paige, ag photo, outdoor recreation photo, pictorial photo and portrait photo.
Chris Flynn, feature photo.
David Olson, feature reporting, " Named for a Fargo diner, Marge the bison is known for her attitude, waistline ," and government reporting, "Fighting for a future."
David Samson, sports photo.
Jeff Kolpack, sports reporting series, for his stories about the transfer portal.
Tracy Briggs, personal column - humorous, " Halloween in the '70s: Cheap plastic masks, soggy Snickers and Tom Jones ," and personal column - serious, " 10 things that brought joy on a sad milestone birthday ."
Fourth place winners
Anna Paige, sports photo.
C.S. Hagen, reporting series, for his stories on the Plymouth Brethren church Plymouth Brethren church .
Chris Flynn, picture story.
Tracy Briggs, sports feature, " Muhammad Ali once knocked out by North Dakota blizzard ."
Forum staff, general excellence.
